meanings.definition: To remove or detach a hook or hooks from something.
meanings.sent1: She was unhooking her coat from the rack.
meanings.sent2: He unhooked the fish from the line and threw it back into the water.
meanings.sent3: The magician unhooked the scarf from thin air, leaving the audience amazed.
meanings.sent4: With a swift motion, she unhooked the necklace from her neck, symbolizing freedom.
meanings.sent5: The key to unhooking the mystery lay in the old journal hidden in the attic.

meanings.definition: The act of releasing or disconnecting a hook or hooks from something.
meanings.sent1: The unhooking of the boat from the dock signaled the start of the journey.
meanings.sent2: He heard the loud sound of the unhooking during the fishing competition.
meanings.sent3: The unhooking of the phone call left her feeling relieved and at peace.
meanings.sent4: The unhooking of the chain from the gate symbolized the end of an era.
meanings.sent5: The unhooking of the last piece of the puzzle finally solved the mystery.
